definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to pluck (a string)/to play (a string instrument)/to spring or leap/to shoot (e.g. with a catapult)/(of cotton) to fluff or tease/to flick/to flip/to accuse/to impeach/elastic (of materials)

sentences.english: Twinblades no longer fire their missiles at infantry.
sentences.chinese: 雙刃不再對步兵使用火箭彈攻擊。

sentences.english: About twenty or thirty of them a week were falling on London at present.
sentences.chinese: 目前，像這樣的火箭彈倫敦大約每週要捱上二三十枚。

sentences.english: Our army destroyed the enemy's blockhouse with a rocket bomb.
sentences.chinese: 我軍利用火箭彈炸燬了敵軍的碉堡。

sentences.english: Thus, it was equipped with powerful air-to-ground cluster rockets.
sentences.chinese: 因此，她配備了強大的空對地集束火箭彈。

sentences.english: Somewhere far away a rocket bomb exploded with a dull, reverberating roar.
sentences.chinese: 遠處什麼地方爆炸了一枚火箭彈，炸聲沉悶震耳。

sentences.english: The force system during burning of the rocket having fore-located nozzles is analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 本文分析了具有前噴管的火箭彈在主動段的受力情況。

sentences.english: Earlier that day, a young man had been vaporized by an exploding rocket.
sentences.chinese: 就在當天早些時候，一個年輕人被火箭彈炸死。

sentences.english: The rockets were smuggled in through tunnels under the border with Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 火箭彈是通過和埃及邊界的地下隧道偷運進來的。

sentences.english: His residence is rocketed almost every night.
sentences.chinese: 他的住所幾乎每晚都遭火箭彈襲擊。

sentences.english: Witnesses said the insurgents launched a rocket-propelled grenade against one of the cars.
sentences.chinese: 目擊者說，武裝分子朝着其中一輛汽車發射了火箭彈。

sentences.english: This paper aimed at a kind of low cost control system working on a type of HVP.
sentences.chinese: 本文針對某型火箭彈設計了成本較低的一種簡控系統。

sentences.english: A rocket bomb must have dropped quite near at hand.
sentences.chinese: 一枚火箭彈想必就墜落在離自己眼前。

definition: lit. as if sitting on pins and needles (idiom)/fig. to be in an uncomfortable situation
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
North and South Korea/bilateral Korean relations
lit. to directly attack Huanglong/fig. to directly combat the root of a problem
